item.title: 华尔街期货因人工智能乐观情绪和中美贸易休战而上涨
item.description: 受对人工智能需求和中美贸易休战的乐观预期影响，华尔街期货周一上涨，为 11 月份拉开了帷幕。【原文：Wall Street futures gained on Monday, kicking off November on firmer ground, on the back of optimism around AI demand and a U.S.-China trade truce.】

item.title: 微软将在阿联酋投资超过 150 亿美元，并获得美国人工智能芯片出口许可证
item.description: 微软公司周一表示，计划在到 2029 年底的七年内向阿联酋投资超过 150 亿美元，并已从特朗普政府获得向这个海湾国家运送先进芯片的出口许可证。【原文：Microsoft plans to invest over $15 billion in the United Arab Emirates in the seven years to the end of 2029 and has secured export licenses from the Trump administration to ship advanced chips to the Gulf country, it said Monday.】

item.title: Xanadu Quantum 拟通过 36 亿美元 SPAC 交易上市
item.description: Xanadu Quantum Technologies 公司周一宣布，将通过与空白支票公司 Crane Harbor Acquisition Corp 合并，以 36 亿美元的价格在美国上市。【原文：Xanadu Quantum Technologies will go public in the United States through a merger with blank-check firm Crane Harbor Acquisition Corp in a $3.6 billion deal, the companies announced on Monday.】

item.title: Beyond Meat 将季度收益报告推迟至 11 月 11 日发布
item.description: Beyond Meat 周一表示，由于需要更多时间量化与部分资产相关的减值费用，该公司将把第三季度业绩报告推迟一周发布。【原文：Beyond Meat said on Monday it is delaying its third-quarter results report by a week as it requires more time to quantify an impairment charge related to some of its assets.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司批准针对 1,100 名工人的裁员计划
item.description: 巴西国营石油公司（Petrobras）周一表示，其董事会已批准了一项新的自愿裁员计划，该计划针对约 1100 名员工。【原文：Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras said on Monday that its board of directors has approved a new voluntary redundancy program targeting about 1,100 people.】

item.title: 特斯拉 10 月份在欧洲部分市场的销量再次下滑
item.description: 特斯拉 10 月份在挪威、瑞典和丹麦的销量大幅下滑，这是这家美国电动汽车制造商在欧洲继续挣扎的最新迹象，但该公司在法国的销量连续第二个月出现小幅增长。【原文：Tesla's sales plunged in October in Norway, Sweden and Denmark in the latest sign that the U.S. electric vehicle maker's European struggles continue, but the company posted a small gain in France for the second consecutive month.】

item.title: 金佰利公司将以 487 亿美元收购 Kenvue 公司
item.description: 金佰利公司（Kimberly-Clark）周一表示，将以现金加股票的方式收购泰诺（Tylenol）生产商肯维（Kenvue），交易价值约为 487 亿美元，从而成为美国最大的健康消费品公司之一。【原文：Kimberly-Clark said on Monday it will buy Tylenol maker Kenvue in a cash-and-stock deal valued at about $48.7 billion, to create one of the biggest consumer health goods companies in the United States.】

item.title: 早间竞价关税听证会前的 11 月提振
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的关键所在。【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today.】

item.title: 微软与 IREN 签订 97 亿美元合同，购买 Nvidia 芯片
item.description: 微软与数据中心运营商IREN达成了一项协议，其中包括使用英伟达（Nvidia）的先进芯片，旨在缓解计算能力不足的问题，这一问题一直阻碍着这家科技巨头从人工智能热潮中充分获利。【原文：Microsoft has struck a deal with data-center operator IREN that includes access to Nvidia's advanced chips, aiming to ease the computing crunch that has kept the tech giant from fully cashing in on the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 低收入消费者受到挤压，美国经济面临动荡风险
item.description: 未来几周，美国消费者作为经济支柱的持久性可能会经受考验，因为医疗保健成本上升、联邦食品福利可能丧失，以及就业市场前景不稳已经对收入造成影响，这些因素都会对家庭预算造成压力，尤其是对不太富裕的家庭而言。【原文：The U.S. consumer's durability as a prop for the economy may be tested in coming weeks as family budgets, particularly among the less affluent, are stressed by rising healthcare costs, the potential loss of federal food benefits, and a wobbly job market outlook that is already taking a toll on earnings.】

item.title: 投资者云集，美国银行首席执行官面临提高回报和交易的呼声
item.description: 本周三，美国银行的高管们将上台向投资者发表讲话，他们面临着通过交易和财富管理提高回报的压力，以赶上更大的竞争对手摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase）。【原文：As Bank of America executives step on stage on Wednesday to address investors, they face pressure to boost returns through dealmaking and wealth management to catch up with larger rival JPMorgan Chase .】

item.title: 独家报道：嘉能可计划因成本问题关闭加拿大最大的铜金属运营公司
item.description: 两位知情人士称，由于环境问题和升级设施需要数百万美元，Glencore 正计划关闭其加拿大最大的铜金属生产企业 Horne 冶炼厂。【原文：Glencore is planning to close its Horne smelter, Canada's largest copper metal-producing operation, due to environmental issues and the millions of dollars needed to upgrade the facility, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 薪酬初创公司 Deel 任命 Intuit 前高管考夫曼为首席财务官，以实现首次公开募股目标
item.description: Deel 周一任命 Intuit 前高管乔-考夫曼（Joe Kauffman）为首席财务官，以支持这家薪资初创公司最快明年上市的可能计划。【原文：Deel on Monday appointed former Intuit executive Joe Kauffman as chief financial officer to support the payroll startup's possible plans to go public as soon as next year.】

item.title: 中美贸易解冻，巴西大豆价格回落，中国买家采购巴西大豆
item.description: 最近几天，中国大豆进口商加大了对巴西货物的采购力度，因为南美大豆价格在中美贸易协议将导致美国恢复对世界最大大豆进口国销售的预期下有所回落。【原文：Chinese soybean importers have stepped up purchases of Brazilian cargoes in recent days as South American prices eased on expectations a U.S.-China trade deal will lead to a resumption of U.S. sales to the world's largest soybean importer.】

item.title: 消息称 Pony AI 将以每股 139 港元的价格在香港上市
item.description: 两位知情人士周一表示，中国自动驾驶公司小马AI将以每股139港元（17.90美元）的价格在香港上市。【原文：Chinese autonomous driving firm Pony AI is set to price its Hong Kong listing at HK$139 ($17.90) per share, two people with knowledge of the matter said on Monday.】

item.title: 关税、TACO 和美元：特朗普 2.0 年的全球市场
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普当选美国总统后的一年里，全球金融市场不得不应对政策冲击、前所未有的不确定性和剧烈波动，股票、黄金和加密货币屡创新高。【原文：In the year since Donald Trump's election as U.S. president, global financial markets have had to navigate policy shocks and unprecedented uncertainty and high volatility, with stocks, gold and crypto hitting record highs.】

item.title: 消息人士称，吉利计划利用上汽通用汽车在中国的前工厂生产清洁能源汽车
item.description: 一位直接了解该计划的人士表示，中国吉利控股集团（GEELY.UL）将利用上汽集团和美国合作伙伴通用汽车公司曾在东北城市沈阳拥有的一家工厂生产清洁能源汽车。【原文：China's Geely Holding Group (GEELY.UL) will use a factory once owned by SAIC Motor and U.S. partner General Motors in the northeastern city of Shenyang to produce clean energy vehicles, said a person with direct knowledge of the plan.】

item.title: 独家报道激进分子 Palliser 在信中呼吁力拓竞购泰克公司
item.description: 路透社看到的一封写给力拓董事会的信显示，激进基金 Palliser Capital 加大了对力拓的压力，要求力拓 "现在或永远 "反竞购泰克资源公司（Teck Resources），敦促这家矿业巨头统一其双重上市结构，并分拆其基本金属业务，以创建一个铜业巨头。【原文：Activist fund Palliser Capital has intensified pressure on Rio Tinto to mount a "now or never" counterbid for Teck Resources, urging the mining giant to unify its dual-listed structure and spin off its base metals business to create a copper powerhouse, a letter to the board seen by Reuters shows.】

item.title: 报纸称特斯拉将在三年内向三星 SDI 购买 20 亿美元的 ESS 电池
item.description: 据《韩国经济日报》周一报道，韩国三星 SDI 已与特斯拉达成协议，将在三年内向特斯拉供应价值超过 3 万亿韩元（21.1 亿美元）的 ESS（储能系统）电池。【原文：South Korea's Samsung SDI has reached an agreement with Tesla to supply more than 3 trillion won ($2.11 billion) worth of ESS (Energy Storage System) batteries to Tesla over three years, the Korea Economic Daily reported on Monday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，大卫-科特支持的 CompoSecure 公司将以 50 亿美元竞购赫斯基科技公司
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一报道，由霍尼韦尔前首席执行官大卫-科特（David Cote）支持的金融科技公司 CompoSecure 将以约 50 亿美元（含债务）的价格从 Platinum Equity 手中收购赫斯基科技公司（Husky Technologies）。【原文：Fintech firm CompoSecure , backed by former Honeywell CEO David Cote, is set to buy Husky Technologies from Platinum Equity for roughly $5 billion including debt, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.】

item.title: 投资者与国家之间的资源争端创十年新高
item.description: 律师事务所 DLA Piper 表示，在资源民族主义和中美两国对关键矿产的竞争日益激烈的推动下，政府和投资者在资源问题上的分歧达到了 10 年来的最高点。【原文：Disagreements between governments and investors over resources are at a 10-year high, law firm DLA Piper said, driven by resource nationalism and growing competition between the U.S. and China for critical minerals.】

item.title: 喜力大肆宣扬 2030 年计划，但投资者希望看到结果
item.description: 喜力已承诺增加收入并削减成本，但这家全球第二大啤酒生产商的投资者表示，可能需要采取更强硬的措施，包括关闭工厂，才能使其业务正常运转。【原文：Heineken has pledged to bolster its revenue and cut costs, but investors in the world's No. 2 beer maker say tougher steps, including plant closures, may be needed to get its business up to speed.】

item.title: 英国石油公司将以 15 亿美元出售美国陆上中游资产股份
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP）周一表示，将以 15 亿美元的价格向投资公司 Sixth Street 管理的基金出售其美国陆上油气业务二叠纪和鹰福特中游资产的股份。【原文：BP said on Monday it would sell stakes in the Permian and Eagle Ford midstream assets of its U.S. onshore oil and gas business for $1.5 billion to funds managed by investment firm Sixth Street.】

item.title: 关税动荡消退，工业巨头重新站稳脚跟
item.description: 今年以来，工业企业试图适应美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）不断变化的贸易政策，经历了过山车式的发展，但本季度，企业高管们表示，随着企业有时间适应美国对进口外国商品征收更高的关税，这种困惑可能正在消退。【原文：Industrial companies have been on a roller-coaster this year as they tried to adjust to the shifting trade policies of U.S. President Donald Trump, but this quarter, executives suggested the confusion may be receding as corporations have had time to adjust to higher levies on U.S. imports of foreign goods.】

item.title: 更快交付波音飞机帮助瑞安航空提高利润和客运量预期
item.description: 瑞安航空公司周一公布的六个月税后利润超出预期，并上调了客运量预期，原因是波音飞机交付时间早于预期，且上半年需求强劲。【原文：Ryanair reported forecast-beating six-month post-tax profit on Monday and nudged up its passenger traffic forecast after earlier than expected Boeing deliveries and strong first-half demand.】

item.title: 最高法院不会阻止特朗普的关税政策。官员们说，处理它
item.description: 美国工厂设备制造商 OTC 工业技术公司长期以来一直利用低成本国家（先是中国，后是印度）供应零部件，但唐纳德-特朗普总统对众多贸易伙伴征收关税的举措颠覆了首席执行官比尔-卡纳迪（Bill Canady）的供应链数学。【原文：U.S. factory equipment maker OTC Industrial Technologies has long used low-cost countries to supply components - first China and later India - but President Donald Trump's blitz of tariffs on numerous trade partners has upended the supply chain math for CEO Bill Canady.】

item.title: 独家报道：埃克森美孚首席执行官警告欧盟可持续发展法可能会终止欧洲业务
item.description: 埃克森美孚首席执行官达伦-伍兹（Darren Woods）周一告诉路透社记者，如果欧盟不对一项可持续发展法律做出重大修改，这家能源巨头将不可能继续在欧洲开展业务。【原文：ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods told Reuters on Monday it will be impossible for the energy giant to continue doing business in Europe if the European Union doesn't make significant changes to a sustainability law that threatens to penalize companies with fines of 5% of global revenue.】

item.title: 早间竞标数据停发，私人工作成焦点
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 香港放宽虚拟资产规则，促进交易流动性
item.description: 一位政府官员周一表示，香港将放宽一项规则，促进虚拟资产交易的流动性，以此作为香港成为主要金融科技和数字资产中心的雄心壮志的一部分。【原文：Hong Kong will ease a rule to promote liquidity for virtual assets trading as part of the city's ambition to become a major fintech and digital asset hub, a government official said on Monday.】

item.title: 全球经济 美国关税冲击订单，亚洲工厂步履维艰
item.description: 周一的商业调查显示，由于美国需求疲软和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统征收关税打击了整个亚洲地区的工厂订单，亚洲的大型制造业中心在10月份举步维艰。【原文：Asia's big manufacturing hubs struggled to fire up in October, business surveys showed on Monday, as weak U.S. demand and tariffs under President Donald Trump hit factory orders across the region.】
